race.name: Sporlings
race.description: Creatures of the undergrowth, born from the mycelial network that binds the forest together.

trait.name: Fungal Fortitude
trait.description: Advantage on saving throws against poison and disease.

trait.name: Spore Cloud
trait.description: As an action, you can release a cloud of non-magical spores in a 15-foot radius. Creatures in the area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier) or become poisoned for 1 minute. This ability recharges after a short or long rest.

trait.name: Symbiotic Connection
trait.description: You have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to find food and water in natural environments.

trait.name: Mycelial Rest
trait.description: Instead of sleeping, Sporlings connect to the mycelium network to rejuvenate. This process takes 1 hour for a short rest and 2 hours for a long rest.

physicalDescription.appearance: Resemble humanoid mushrooms with varying degrees of sentience. Colors range from vibrant greens and browns to more subdued grays and whites.
physicalDescription.size: Typically smaller than humans, comparable to halflings or gnomes.

equipment.item: Spore Pouch: A small pouch containing dried spores that can be used to create a distracting cloud or to enhance natural camouflage.

suggestedBackgrounds.background: Hermit: Many Sporelings live solitary lives, cultivating their own patches of mushrooms.
Outlander: Some Sporelings are wanderers, exploring the natural world and forging connections with other creatures.
Folk Hero: Sporelings who champion the rights of nature and protect the environment.

roleplayingNotes.note: Sporelings are a young race, still developing their own culture and society.
They have a deep connection to nature and often feel a kinship with plants and animals.
Many Sporelings are wary of other races, especially those who hunt or consume mushrooms.
Some Sporlings may have unique abilities based on the type of mushroom they originated from, such as the ability to produce glowing spores or create illusions.
